headline: Week’s Best: Planning for Trump 2.0
summary: Wealthy investors might be cheering an incoming administration that is generally seen as pro-business, but advisors should take this time to reassess financial plans with high-net-worth clients, our guest columnist writes.  The uncertainty around the extension of the 2017 tax cuts, for example, prompted many wealthy families to reconsider their estate plans.  It has been said that the very rich are different from the rest of us, but advisors know that money doesn’t buy a worry-free life and that wealthy clients have their share of anxieties just like everyone else.
